text: The city of Dexter, Missouri, located in Missouri's 8th congressional district in southeastern Missouri, is the largest city in Stoddard County, Missouri. {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Ross * (1897-1971) | c. 1952 | 1956 | bgcolor=#f7f7ff| (He previously served as mayor.) |- | rowspan=1 | Gilbert G. Ross * (1897-1971) | c. 1957 | 1964 | bgcolor=#f7f7ff| (He previously served as mayor.) |- | Rev. Dr. Melvin Gainer, Jr. * (1920-2003) | 1964 | 1966 | He was an expert rifleman who landed at Utah Beach during D-Day and became the last- surviving scout for General Patton. Gainer also worked for Gen. Eisenhower in Versailles and earned many military honors. He became a jeweler and a Southern Baptist minister after the war. |- | rowspan=1 | Wilis Conner * (1919-2004) | 1966 | c. 1996 | He served as mayor for about 30 years. |- | Myra Pritchett | c. 1996 | c. 2000 | |- | John Pruitt |2000 | 2002 | |- | Joe Weber | 2002 | 2018 | |- |} ==References== * Missouri Secretary of State official manuals ==External links== *Charles E. title: List of mayors of Dexter, Missouri
